cd:Record.name: Level_2B_Proc_Params_03_00
cd:Record.cd:Description: Level 2B Processing Parameters GADS DSR
Fields responsible for populating the Fixed Header

cd:Text.cd:Description: 1-line description of the file
Multi-lines free text
Aeolus
AE
1-Line description of the file class

cd:Integer.cd:Description: 4 digits used to distinguish between versions of a file having the same validity period

cd:Text.cd:Description: Aeolus L1bP
Aeolus L1bP
Version of the tool

cd:Record.cd:Description: Values responsible for populating the main product header

cd:Text.cd:Description: Reference document describing the product
Software version number of processing software. Format: name of processor (up to 10 char) version number (4 char)
AEOLUS PHS

cd:Record.cd:Description: Processing parameters for Wind Velocity Measurement

cd:Text.cd:Description: File type string
ASCII string describing the product

cd:Float.cd:Description: Tolerance above which Mie and Rayleigh rangebins are considered mismatched

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Flag indicating whether the horizontal or line-of-sight wind component should be reported
Maximum number of observations that may be generated for the Mie channel
Maximum number of observations that may be generated for the Rayleigh channel

cd:Record.cd:Description: Parameters controlling the possible grouping schemes applied by the L2B processing.

cd:Text.cd:Description: Method to be used for composing groups of measurements, determining the maximum possible observation size after classification and accumulation.

cd:Float.cd:Description: maximum allowed vertical difference be- tween 2 Mie rangebins with the same index. If a rangebin is found that has a larger difference a new group will be started
maximum allowed vertical difference between 2 Rayleigh rangebins with the same index. If a rangebin is found that has a larger difference a new group will be started
maximum horizontal difference between first and last Mie measurement in a group. If a measurement at larger distance is found a new group will be started
maximum horizontal difference between first and last Rayleigh measurement in a group. If a measurement at larger distance is found a new group will be started
maximum length of missing Mie measure- ments before a group definition is closed and a new group is started
maximum length of missing Rayleigh measurements before a group definition is closed and a new group is started

cd:Integer.cd:Description: define how many BRCs will be combined together is a group, in case the grouping method is set to combine BRCs

cd:Record.cd:Description: Parameters for the Classification algorithm

cd:Text.cd:Description: The classification type for the Mie channel
The classification type for the Rayleigh channel

cd:Record.cd:Description: List of BackscatterRatio_threshold structures
used for classification of a rangebin using a threshold on the backscatter ratio

cd:Float.cd:Description: Thresholds to be used for classification of a rangebin
Altitude at which Threshold_Value is valid

cd:Record.cd:Description: List of BackscatterRatio_threshold structures
used for classification of a rangebin using a threshold on the backscatter ratio

cd:Float.cd:Description: Thresholds to be used for classification of a rangebin
Altitude at which Threshold_Value is valid

cd:Record.cd:Description: List of Extinction_threshold structures
used for classification of a rangebin using a threshold on the extinction value

cd:Float.cd:Description: Thresholds to be used for classification of a rangebin
Altitude at which Threshold_Value is valid

cd:Record.cd:Description: List of Extinction_threshold structures
used for classification of a rangebin using a threshold on the extinction value

cd:Float.cd:Description: Thresholds to be used for classification of a rangebin
Altitude at which Threshold_Value is valid

cd:Record.cd:Description: Parameters for the algorithms determining the optical properties of the atmosphere

cd:Text.cd:Description: The method to be used to get the scattering ratio
A backup method to get the scattering ratio, to be used when ScatRatio_Method gives no result, i.e. returns a missing_data indicator
the method to be used to get the particle extinction.
the method to be used to get the molecular extinction.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Minimum Altitude at which scattering ratio (Rho) may be set to 1
Filter exponent used to damp oscillatory behaviour when retrieving bin extinction
Optional predefined cross-talk factor (not used when set to -1.0)

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Window width in horizontal (x) direction used by median filter
Window width in vertical (y) direction used by median filter
If True: take Rayleigh Channel calibration values from the Aux. Cal. input file; if False: derive these values from the upper range bin
If True: derive cross-talk factor from the Aux.Cal input file; if False: t.b.d.
Apply the median filter to smooth out noise after applying the 2D feature finder
apply the 2D feature finder algorithm to find cloud and/or aerosol layers in each group of measurements

cd:Float.cd:Description: Threshold used to decide of the Rayleigh channel calibration factor as derived from the upper range bin is to be trusted or not

cd:Record.cd:Description: Parameters for the algorithms determining the Error properties of the reported wind results

cd:Text.cd:Description: The method to be used to calculate the Error quantifier for the Mie channel
The method to be used to calculate the Error quantifier for the Rayleigh channel

cd:Record.cd:Description: Common Processing Parameters
Processing parameters for Mie product confidence params SNR and backscatter-ratio

cd:Float.cd:Description: Correction factor for the calculation of the Mie SNR

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Summation index for calculation of SNR and backscatter ratio

cd:Record.cd:Description: Processing parameters for Mie Core Algorithm as applied for measurement data

cd:Float.cd:Description: Threshold to switch Mie-Core processing on/off
Starting value for FWHM
Stop threshold for quadratic sum of differences between modeled and measured ACCD counts per pixel

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Maximum number of iterations in Lorentz fit-loop

cd:Float.cd:Description: Upper threshold for FWHM of Lorentz function for quality check
Lower threshold for FWHM of Lorentz function for quality check
Relative (upper) threshold for peak height of Lorentz function
Relative (lower) threshold for peak height of Lorentz function
Peak location threshold
Stop threshold for Downhill Simplex algorithm merit function

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Maximum number of interations of Downhill Simplex algorithm
Number of functional evaluations of Lorentz fit function for one pixel

cd:Record.cd:Description: Processing parameters for Mie Core Algorithm as applied for internal reference pulses

cd:Float.cd:Description: Threshold to switch Mie-Core processing on/off
Starting value for FWHM
Stop threshold for quadratic sum of differences between modeled and measured ACCD counts per pixel

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Maximum number of iterations in Lorentz fit-loop

cd:Float.cd:Description: Upper threshold for FWHM of Lorentz function for quality check
Lower threshold for FWHM of Lorentz function for quality check
Relative (upper) threshold for peak height of Lorentz function
Relative (lower) threshold for peak height of Lorentz function
Peak location threshold
Stop threshold for Downhill Simplex algorithm merit function

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Maximum number of interations of Downhill Simplex algorithm
Number of functional evaluations of Lorentz fit function for one pixel

cd:Record.cd:Description: Parameters for corrupt data detection

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Maximum signal derivative. Maximum valid pixel intensity difference between adjacent CCD pixels
Pixel saturation threshold

cd:Record.cd:Description: Parameters used by the Mie algorithm.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Switch to select whether L1B Mie Core Al- gorithm Parameters should be copied/used in the L2BP
In case Mie Core Algorithm Parameters are taken from the L1B product, copy the parameters used for measurement fitting to the parameters used for internal reference fitting

cd:Text.cd:Description: Switch to select Mie height assignment method.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Weight given to upper altitude of range bin (applicable when Mie Height Assign- ment Method = use fixed weight).

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Switch to select whether Mie Nonlinearity Correction should be skipped in the L2BP or not
Switch to select whether Mie Nonlinearity Correction (calibration data) should be extrapolated in the L2BP or not
Switch to select whether (Mie) Reference Pulse Zero Frequency should be used in the L2BP or not
Switch to select whether (Mie) Measurement Channel Zero Frequency should be used in the L2BP or not

cd:Float.cd:Description: Weight given to ACCD column 20 in (Mie) offset subtraction

cd:Record.cd:Description: List of SNR threshold structures to be used for quality control of L2B Mie hlos retrievals.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Threshold to be used for quality control of L2B Mie hlos retrievals
Lowest altitude at which Threshold Value is valid
Highest altitude at which Threshold Value is valid

cd:Text.cd:Description: Description of reference level for altitude.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: A switch to force all clear Mie winds to be flagged invalid

cd:Record.cd:Description: Parameters used by the RBC algorithm

cd:Text.cd:Description: Switch to select Rayleigh height assignment method.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Weight given to upper altitude of range bin (applicable when Rayleigh Height Assignment Method = use fixed weight)

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Switch to select whether Mie_Decontamination should be done in the L2BP or not
A switch to force all cloudy Rayleigh winds to be flagged invalid

cd:Float.cd:Description: Minimum atmospheric signal LOS speed component
Maximum atmospheric signal LOS speed component
Minimum reference signal LOS speed component
Maximum reference signal LOS speed component
Minimum gradient of LOS speed component with respect to rayleigh Response
Maximum gradient of LOS speed component with respect to rayleigh Response
Minimum gradient of LOS speed component with respect to atmospheric temperature
Maximum gradient of LOS speed component with respect to atmospheric temperature
Minimum gradient of LOS speed component with respect to atmospheric pressure
Maximum gradient of LOS speed component with respect to atmospheric pressure
Minimum gradient of LOS speed component with respect to atmospheric scattering ratio
Maximum gradient of LOS speed component with respect to atmospheric scattering ratio

cd:Record.cd:Description: Parameters used by the L1B-AMD matchup algorithm

cd:Text.cd:Description: Matchup method to be used for L1B-AMD matchup. 0: one-for-one between L1B BRC and AMD DSR, 1: Nearest-neighbour in space and time

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Maximum allowed time difference in seconds between L1B BRC and AMD DSR
Maximum allowed distance in kilometres between L1B BRC and AMD DSR
Maximum Analysis time difference in seconds

cd:Record.cd:Description: Parameters used by the L1B-CLM matchup algorithm

cd:Text.cd:Description: Matchup method to be used for L1B-CLM matchup. 0: TBD, 1: Nearest-neighbour in space and time

cd:Text.cd:Description: Zero-Wind Correction scheme to be used for L2B Mie processing.
Zero-Wind Correction scheme to be used for L2B Rayleigh processing.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Mie ground correction weighting factor
Mie HBE ground correction weighting factor
Rayleigh ground correction weighting factor
Rayleigh HBE ground correction weighting factor
Mie-Rayleigh ground correction weighting factor
Mie-Rayleigh HBE ground correction weighting factor
Mie-Rayleigh ground correction weighting offset

cd:Record.cd:Description: Parameters to control the Range Dependent Bias (RDB) correction

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Switch to select whether Mie Range Dependent Bias correction should be done in the L2BP
Switch to select whether Rayleigh Range Dependent Bias correction should be done in the L2BP
